Job Title: Regional Sales Manager

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Title: Regional Sales Manager 
Position Summary:The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) under BGI Americas Corporation will directly manage BGI’s genomics & proteomics service business with academic and industry accounts in designated sales territory of the United States and Canada if it may apply to. The candidate will be responsible for growing territory revenue, managing the account manager, and managing and developing customer relationship in the sales territory. 
Job Location: Located in Midwest States, Illinois or Boston preferred. 
Major Responsibilities:Be directly responsible for achieving designated territory revenue and payment targets.Understand and maintain current knowledge of the company's products and services. Keep informed on technological developments, market competition, policies and regulation. Utilize resources and perform research to determine sales patterns and strategies for different market sectors.Explore new accounts and KOLs in academic, industry and government sectors in designated territory.Manage existing accounts in academic, industry and government sectors in designated territory.Implement a consultative selling approach to understand customers’ projects needs. Work with FAS team and other internal resources to perform project evaluation, develop and communicate project proposals with customers, negotiate and close sales contracts.Effectively communicate BGI’s technology and product strength to customers. Develop tailored and competitive project solutions that meet customer’s project goals and expectation.Assume overall accountability for establishing and implementing an effective sales plan, meeting regional sales goals with budgeted resources and developing key account sales strategies. Perform territory business analysis and report results to the point contact on a regular basis.Champion Mass Spectrometry analysis services as new product solutions to BGI’s existing and growing customer base. Proactively develop and manage key customers or collaborators to further solidify BGI’s multi-omics analysis business in the US.Effectively coordinate with account manager and project managers to ensure smooth execution of projects and proper communication of project status to clients. Work with FAS team to perform pre-sale and post-sale consulting and address customer’s inquiries to project deliverables.Attending the national conferences and mainly responsible for organizing the regional conference, online events and corporate meetings as scheduled.Understand BGI’s value proposition in broader scope and being able to communicate BGI’s vision beyond research services. 
Job Requirements:Very Competent in NGS (including Single-Cell Sequencing), and Mass Spec Applications.Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in Scientific Discipline, Master’s or PhD is a plus3-10 Years Field Sales Experience. Master’s or PhD degree will be considered in lieu of Sales Experience.Progressive, Forward-Thinking, Passionate, and Proactive.Hunter-mentality, and one that takes Initiative to find new business opportunities in both Academia and BioPharma Accounts.Is comfortable and looks forward to cold-calling, engaging new customers, and travels to customer site as needed for conferences.Engages in Customer Presentations, both in-person and via video-calls.Participates in Company involvement with National Scientific Conferences.Is comfortable with and willing to travel 50% of the time.Comfortable with e-mail Marketing and mail-merge.Team-Player that looks forward to interacting and sharing with other Team Members in a Matrix Environment.

Organization: BGI Americas Corporation is the leading provider of genomics and proteomics services in the Americas Region as part of BGI Genomics, a public company listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange. Established in 2010, BGI Americas has grown to include presence in Boston and San Jose, serving a wide range of customers in genetics research, drug R&D and diagnostics. We have more than 20 years of genomics experience helping our customers achieve their research goals by delivering rapid, high quality results using a broad array of cost-effective, cutting-edge technologies, including our own innovative DNBseq™ sequencing technology. BGI Americas invested a state-of-the-art Mass Spec service center in its San Jose, California laboratory in 2019 in order to further diversify its multi-omics offerings and bioanalytical solutions. We are committed to advancing genetic research, technologies and applications to benefit the mankind.

Contact Information: If you feel your skills and experience meet the requirements of the job please forward a cover letter and CV to the following email: bgia_recruiting@bgi.com
Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting base pay for this role is $75,000. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonuses and benefits.

Experience Level (if available): None
